intro: Platycentrum teysmannianum, commonly known as the Teymann's starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of the carrot family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
